description.plain: Ace Hood’s real name is Antoine McColister. He is a rapper from Port St. Lucie, Florida. He is was formerly signed to We the Best Music Group and was along with Def Jam Recordings, Cash Money Records and Epic Records. He is best known his association with DJ Khaled and for the singles “Bugatti” (featuring Future and Rick Ross in 2012, “Hustle Hard” in 2011, and Overtime (featuring Akon and T-Pain in 2009. His debut album, Gutta was released in 2008.

His debut album, Gutta was released in 2008.

songs.title: Bugatti

description.plain:
First single of Ace Hood’s 3rd studio album Trials & Tribulations, featuring Ricky Rozay & Future. By far the most successful Ace Hood single of his career.



The song was remixed which included an all-star lineup feature artists DJ Khaled, Meek Mill, T.I., Wiz Khalifa, Birdman, French Montana & 2 Chainz.

songs.artist_names: Ace Hood (Ft. Lil Wayne & Rick Ross)
songs.full_title: Hustle Hard (Remix) by Ace Hood (Ft. Lil Wayne & Rick Ross)
songs.title: Hustle Hard (Remix)
songs.title_with_featured: Hustle Hard (Remix) (Ft. Lil Wayne & Rick Ross)

description.plain:
Hustle Hard is the first official single from Ace Hood’s third studio album Blood, Sweat & Tears. It originally appeared on Ace Hood’s preceding mixtape The Statement.

The official remix features Rick Ross and Lil Wayne. The original music video and half of the remix music video was made on the same day. The remix music video was released to 106 & Park: BET’s Top 10 Live, on his birthday, May 11, 2011.

Los Angeles Dodgers left fielder Matt Kemp, Milwaukee Brewers second baseman Rickie Weeks, his younger brother – Oakland Athletics second baseman Jemile Weeks, Philadelphia Phillies outfielder John Mayberry, Jr., New York Mets shortstop José Reyes, San Francisco Giants third baseman Pablo Sandoval, and New York Yankees outfielder Andruw Jones currently use it as their entrance music. Also, the song is reportedly listened to by star Pittsburgh Penguins center Sidney Crosby to help with his post concussion symptoms,

body.plain:
Hustle Hard is the first official single from Ace Hood’s third studio album Blood, Sweat & Tears. It originally appeared on Ace Hood’s preceding mixtape The Statement.

The official remix features Rick Ross and Lil Wayne. The original music video and half of the remix music video was made on the same day. The remix music video was released to 106 & Park: BET’s Top 10 Live, on his birthday, May 11, 2011.

Los Angeles Dodgers left fielder Matt Kemp, Milwaukee Brewers second baseman Rickie Weeks, his younger brother – Oakland Athletics second baseman Jemile Weeks, Philadelphia Phillies outfielder John Mayberry, Jr., New York Mets shortstop José Reyes, San Francisco Giants third baseman Pablo Sandoval, and New York Yankees outfielder Andruw Jones currently use it as their entrance music. Also, the song is reportedly listened to by star Pittsburgh Penguins center Sidney Crosby to help with his post concussion symptoms,
